turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You work here?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I run the place. What can I get you?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Nifty.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: The world is what you make of it, friend. If it doesn't fit, you make alterations.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I'll drink to that. Will you join me, Miss --

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Stella.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Paden.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Stella... Are you the midnight star herself?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I am. I'm always there, but I only shine at night.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: My compliments to you, Miss Stella. This is what I call a saloon.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Thanks. That's what I call it too.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: And I know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: You like a good saloon?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: It's the only place I'm happy.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Me too. What's wrong with us?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You wouldn't be needing any help around here, would you? Maybe with the gambling?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: You see that fellow over there in the gray coat?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: That's Kelly, my so-called partner. He runs that side.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: So-called?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Yeah, aside from being a loud-mouthed, lying cheat, he's just the man I would have picked.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Why'd you go into business with him?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I don't own this place. The man who does stuck me with Kelly.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Who's the owner?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Here he comes right now.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Is this a fair mix?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I'm saving lives here. The straight stuff would raise a blood blister on boot leather.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I meant, seemed like a lot of whiskey.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: That's the good stuff.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Oh, yeah? How good?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: You really are a gambler.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Give me some of the good stuff.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Where's the dog now?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: He left me.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: What is it that I can't figure?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Cobb's got something on you, and it must be pretty good.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: If he didn't you'd never sit still while this was happening.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You sure? Maybe that's the kind of friend I am.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Nah!  What's he got? This is a nice saloon, but there are other nice saloons. It's not the money. Not for you. Why can't I get ahold of it?  Cobb says there's no telling what you're going to care about.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: Is that what he said? Well, he figured it okay this time.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Some people think because they're stronger -- or meaner -- they can push you around. I've seen a lot of that. But it's only true if you let it be. The world is what you make of it.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I like your attitude. But it can be risky.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I'm ready for that.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: How about you?

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: I don't want you to get hurt.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: He can't hurt me if he's dead.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I've got a place I can hide her.

turns.speaker: PADEN
turns.text: You better get in there with her until this thing is over.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Stella, this is one of my oldest surviving friends. Treat him right.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: That was my plan.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: Oh, yeah, you two are going to get along fine. You got a lot in common.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: It's an advance. We want him to know he's going to be happy here.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I wouldn't worry about that.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: I thought you two would get along.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: From what I've seen, Paden doesn't care much about money.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF COBB
turns.text: He says he doesn't care about anything, but he does. There's just no telling what it's going to be.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: -- Forgive me, Mr. Taransky.  I'm just trying to understand.  All these films, TV appearances, magazine covers, internet interviews, publicity photos, snapshots from her childhood -- all fake.  This is fake, this is fake -- fake, fake, fake, all fake.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: That's right.  You understand perfectly.  I will confess to fraud, not murder.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: A fan club with a worldwide membership in the millions -- also bogus?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Oh, no.  The fan club is real.  But they were worshipping computer code -- ones and zeros.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: So, of course, you couldn't kill Simone because there never was a Simone.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: And this Mr. Hank Aleno who you talk so much about, a renowned failure, who also happens to be so conveniently dead -- perhaps the "man" you claim helped invent Simone is an invention himself?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: But not everyone's imaginary, are they, Mr. Taransky?  I refer, of course, to Edith.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Can you tell us why you were disposing of the body of a woman who didn't exist?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It wasn't her body.  It was her body of work.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Why don't you just come clean, Viktor?  Tell the truth.  You'll feel better afterwards.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I am telling the truth.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: We all know what happened.  In a fit of jealous rage you killed Simone and dumped her body off a boat she bought for you.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No!!  I can prove it to you.  I'll take you to her.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I'd love to stop somewhere but I'm late.  I'm on my way to see Viktor now.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: No, I understand.  That's what I want to talk about.  I don't know if you know this, Simone, but Viktor and I were married once.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I can't imagine how you ever let a man like that go.  I owe Viktor everything.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I think he owes more to you.  But that's not important now.  I know what's going on between you two.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I want to reassure you, Elaine, there's absolutely nothing going on between Viktor and I.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You don't have to protect my feelings, Simone.  I don't blame Viktor for falling in love with the most desirable woman in the world.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm not --  He's not.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: My God, are you alright, Simone?

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Damn --  Yes -- I --  -- I'm just a little tired. Listen, Elaine, Viktor and I -- it's strictly a working relationship.  We could never be anything else.  We're just so... different.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Exactly.  You're a household name now.  You're moving in entirely different worlds.  That's why I hope you're not toying with Viktor.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: It sounds like you still have feelings for him.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: We have a daughter together.  I just don't want to see Viktor get hurt.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I don't know how many times I have to say this, Elaine, but Viktor and I are not in love.  I only make love to the camera.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Simone, I recognize the shirt you're wearing.  I gave it to Viktor on his birthday.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Christ --  Elaine, I know how it looks but...  ... it would mean a lot to Viktor if you'd go with him to the Oscars. If you won't do it for him, please do it for me.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Okay -- for you.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Thanks.  This is my exit so, I --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm glad we talked.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Good-bye.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Of course she is.  No other name is going to sign on now and risk offending her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: We don't need a name.  We'll cast an unknown.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No!  You will not give in to that blackmailing bitch!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Excuse us.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: God, Viktor.  Why do you always have to make things so difficult for yourself?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Difficult.  I'm difficult.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- Do you know what these are, Elaine?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Hmm... Mike and Ike's.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not just any Mike & Ike's -- cherry Mike & Ike's.  Do you know why I, Viktor Taransky, two-time Academy Award nominated director --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- Viktor, that was Short Subject.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- overseeing the most cherished movie project of my career, am walking around with a pocketful of cherry Mike & Ike's?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- I have a feeling you're going to tell me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- I'll tell you why.  It is because Miss Nicola Anders, supermodel with a SAG card God's gift to cinema, has it written into her contract that all cherry Mike & Ike's be removed from her candy dish along with strict instructions that any room she walks into should have seven packs of cigarettes waiting for her three of them opened, that there be a personal jacuzzi within eighty paces of her dressing room, and that any time she travels, her nanny must fly with her first class.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- What's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Elaine, she doesn't have any children!  Don't you see?  We're being held hostage by 12 men and 5 women who someone somewhere has decreed are the A-list.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: The public decides who's on that list.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: It's the truth.  Those 17 superstars are our insurance policy.  We can't open -- can't make a profit without them.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: We can hardly make a profit with them.  Up-front salary, back-end deal, perks, per diem, percentages -- They're mocking us, Elaine. We're at their mercy.  We always had movie stars but they used to be our stars.  We used to decide who would play what role. We told them what to wear, what to say, who to date.  When they were under contract, we could change their names if we wanted to -- more than once!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You realize you're nostalgic for an era you weren't even born in?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Well, I do remember why I started out in this business -- you seem to have forgotten -- working in New York with Cassevetes -- we were trying to do something important, shine a light in that darkened cinema --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- It's called a projector.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- Illuminate hearts and minds with a ray of truth.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Listen, Viktor, I have good memories of those days too -- but this isn't about that or you or me or some high-minded ideal.  This is business.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Spare me.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- Christ, Viktor, look around. What do you think pays for all this?  This is about investment and return.  Those days in New York... that's... it's over.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You're not renewing my contract.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: How can I?  Your last three pictures tanked.  The board is giving me hell.  No bankable star will work with you after this.  If you just compromised... a little.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm not taking away your daughter, just your deal.  You and I both know, after the divorce I kept you on for old time's sake, so you could still hold your head up in front of Lainey.  I called what's his name at Warner's.  He said he'd take a meeting -- in July.  I've fought for you Viktor...  You want to talk severance?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You can have everything -- office, car, assistants -- all I want is the picture.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: The picture's dead.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: So there's no problem -- I can have the rights, the negative too?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: They're yours.  But how are you going to finish it?  Without a star there's no movie.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I don't need a star.  All I need is an actor -- I'll reshoot the part, cut out Nicola and replace her with a real actor.  A real leading lady.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Even if you find her, you know the problem with unknowns, Viktor.  If they're good, they get known.  And then you're back to sorting their candy... and worse.  I'm sorry, Viktor.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Good to see you too, Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Why isn't she with you?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Why?  Because she would never show up at something like this.  She's intensely private.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor... I want to thank you for convincing Simone to sign with the studio.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Don't thank me.  It was entirely Simone's decision.  Do you have Simone's check?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't have it on me.  Anyway, it means a lot.  Have you read the reviews?  They're love letters.  Listen to this one.  "Simone has the voice of a young Jane Fonda, the body of Sophia Loren, the grace of, well, Grace Kelley, and the face of Audrey Hepburn combined with an angel".

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Almost right.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I can't wait to meet her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I don't know if that's going to happen.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: As I say, she's... something of a recluse.  That's how she's able to stay so pure -- by isolating herself in her art.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous.  I arranged a press conference.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Out of the question.  A circus like that?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor, it's my studio.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She's my actor.  There are other studios, Elaine.  There's only one Simone.  Leave the press conference to me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Sorry I didn't get her back in time.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: No problem.  Do you want to come in?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor, we simply have to talk about "Eternity..."

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: "Forever".

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Whatever.  I still haven't received Simone's script notes.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: There aren't any.  If the filmmakers are happy, Simone's happy.  She considers herself an... "instrument".

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Really?  Oh, so she's really going to do all this nudity?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: If it's on the page...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, something has to be done about this budget.  It's completely unrealistic.  You allowed nothing for limousine service.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She'll drive herself.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Hair and make-up?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She'll do her own.  Theater training.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: She was in the theater?  When? Where?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'll send you her resume.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Al least a contingency for wardrobe.  Any woman can go up a dress size.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- I guarantee she won't gain an once.  She's very disciplined.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, we have to do something about this -- "stuntwoman".

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: There isn't one.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No need.  She does all her own stunts.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Even the fall from the plane?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Even the fall from the plane.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, shoot it on the last day.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: As I've tried to explain to you, Elaine.  Simone isn't like any other actress you've ever known. She's about the work and only the work -- lives for the work.  She wants all the money up there...  ... on the screen where it belongs. She'd work for scale except I know you only respect people you pay a fortune.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Which accounts for your percentage.  When do I get to meet this dream?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not today.  She's learning her lines.  You can also take cue cards and teleprompter out of the budget.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'll walk you out.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Listen, Viktor... I want to talk to you now, not as Elaine, studio head, but Elaine, ex-wife.  Second ex-wife.  You got lucky this last time but you need to be careful.  We both know you wouldn't be making this overblown art film of you hadn't convinced Simone to be in it.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Elaine, talking to you now, not as Viktor, director, but Viktor, ex husband... what the hell happened to you?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Experience, Viktor.  I've seen this a hundred times -- young stars destroying the very people who discovered them.  I'm worried about you, that's all.  This woman -- she controls your destiny.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Simone does not control my destiny.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor, I have a feeling.  One of my feelings.  There's something about her I don't trust.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Stunning, Viktor.  The Hollywood Foreign Press is going to eat this up.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank you.  What did you think, Lainey?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I got them to remove the reflection.  The mirror's metaphor -- to show how her character's inwardly dead.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That's genius, Viktor.  Was that Simone's idea?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Who else?  It's always Simone's idea.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Maybe you're right.  Twelve years after your daughter's born you decide to become a father.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Better late than never.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I should fire you more often.  The film's looking wonderful.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You really think so?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Yes.  To be honest I never quite saw this film before -- maybe it's the way Simone is playing it -- but what it's saying about the illusion of permanence in everyday life, how that's the only way we can love -- I think it's really going to mean something.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank you.  I'll tell Simone you liked it.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'd love to tell her myself.  When are you going to let me meet her?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Soon.  Soon.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Everyone I know has met her, Viktor.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Everyone you know is lying.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- You can't go in there!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- We have to talk to her, Viktor!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- It's starting to look like she doesn't support the film or you, Viktor.  If you can't handle her, I will.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not now.  She's emotional.  Her mother dies today.  Scene forty-two of "Good For Nothing".  It's not a good time.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: So, the secret's finally out, Viktor.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- I can explain.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- I don't think that's necessary. I think it's perfectly clear.  I should have guessed -- it all makes sense now... it's why she never goes anywhere, never seen in public...

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: The premiere was the first time I've convinced her to venture out and it just confirmed her worst nightmares.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor, you should have said something.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She doesn't want pity.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You're so good to protect her like this.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'll tell you what.  I know how much this means to you.  I'll try to get her to plug the film.  I'm not promising anything but maybe she'll do a talk show -- taped.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Oh, make it live -- please, Viktor.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'll try.  Maybe live but remote. She'll never go to them.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: She was there.  She didn't by any chance happen to mention me?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She said you were very beautiful.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Elaine, what are you doing tonight? Would you like to go somewhere -- dinner?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'd love to.  But aren't you supposed to meet up with Simone?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Oh, yes.  Of course.  Don't I always?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- Viktor, are you with her?  Is she there?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Are you and Simone...  ... getting married?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No, of course not!  Why?  Would you care if we were?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, yes.  From a studio point of view, it would be better if Simone stayed single.  Anyhow, I thought she came across great tonight.  Intelligent, well informed, a natural.  And touching. She was spectacular.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Viktor, do you realize you always do that?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Whenever I compliment Simone, you take the credit.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I do?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Yes, you do...  Anyway, tonight was a good start.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Excuse me?  Start?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: It's a crowded summer.  We need every photo-opp, sound-byte and column inch we can get.  Good night, Viktor.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: My two favorite girls.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Lainey and I just wanted to congratulate...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: ... Simone.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She's lying down.  She's exhausted.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I can imagine.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Elaine, it's Wednesday.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Is it Wednesday?  It's Wednesday. How embarrassing.  I don't know what I was thinking.  With all the excitement lately...  Am I interrupting something?  Are you expecting company?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: As a matter-of-fact I am.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: When is she coming over?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: About now.  Would you like a drink?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I suppose I could stay, just until she arrives.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Is Simone back to earth yet?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not quite.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm sure you'll keep her focussed. She's lucky to have you, Viktor.  Is she really having your baby?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Impossible.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I just read somewhere --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I know.  I know.  They'll say anything.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- And she was positively glowing at the awards.  I should be going, she'll be here soon --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- She already is.  Simone's not coming over, Elaine.  Not tonight, not ever.  I want you back, Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I want you back too, Viktor.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: This is crazy.  Who am I fooling? I can't compete with Simone.  What woman can?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I would rather have you than Simone.  Believe me.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That's sweet, Viktor, but I couldn't let you do that -- make that kind of sacrifice.  It's strange.  I've stabbed people in the back, clawed and slept my way to where I am -- it goes with the territory -- but, for some reason, I can't betray Simone. There's... I don't know any other way to say it -- there's a goodness to her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No, there isn't.  There's nothing to her.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Oh, Viktor.  You say that now -- because we're here, alone, like this.  But in the morning, you'd go back to her.  What man wouldn't?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No, I will end my relationship with her -- totally.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: But you don't understand.  She'll always be there -- at some party, on some magazine cover, some song on the radio, up on some screen.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No.  She'll never work again -- retire, never make a movie or a record, or appear ever again.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Of course she will.  Her public will demand it.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not if I don't let her.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm going to tell you a secret now, Elaine.  Simone is not a real person.  I invented her.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Every actor is an invention, Viktor.  Don't embarrass yourself. No one's denying that you discovered Simone.  But it's like finding a diamond in the desert. Anyone can trip over it, but it's not the finder who sparkles.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- No, no, I didn't trip over her. You don't understand --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: -- You just got lucky that she's loyal enough to stay with you. Maybe she's staying out of pity, who knows?  She certainly doesn't need you.  Some people even say you're holding her back.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Who says that -- ?  -- Never mind.  You have to listen to me, Elaine.  Simone is thin air, pixels, molded by me from a mathematical equation.  I inherited it from a madman -- I can show you --

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: How much wine have you had?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- She's a figment of my own imagination.  I, Viktor Taransky, have perpetrated the greatest hoax, the greatest sleight-of-hand, sleight-of-mouth, sleight-of- sleight in entertainment history! And still no one appreciates me, recognizes what I've done -- even you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You're drunker than I thought.  Are you doing that again?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No!  Whatever talent Simone has comes from me -- me!  Me!  I swear, as God is my judge.  You don't know what I've been through.  Tens of thousands of mind-numbing hours in front of that screen, nights without end, and look what it's cost me.  Why do you think I've been wearing these?  I may have done irreparable harm to my eyesight, and why?  To extract and refine the infinite nuances of a human being -- a human soul.  Don't you see?  I made Simone!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Can I see you later -- go away for the weekend?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: How can you bring that up at a time like this?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank you!  I don't know how you did it but thank you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Don't thank us too fast, Viktor. You know what we have to do?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Why stop at one character when you can have a whole cast?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Exactly.  Now that you have the studio behind you, we can really do things.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I was thinking -- what about you and... "Simone" moving back in with me and Lainey?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: That sounds wonderful.  How do you feel about all this, Lainey?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Don't look so glum, Viktor.  It's not a death sentence.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No... it's life.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Hello, is this Elaine?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Yes -- oh my, God.  Is that you, Simone?!  I've been wanting to talk to you.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Well, here I am.  You look pretty today.  Red suits you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Right beside you.  I borrowed Viktor's car.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Mom, do you miss Dad?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Sometimes.  But, just when I think your father's changing for the better, I realize he's as self absorbed as ever.  He took the credit for Simone tonight.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Thank Simone for the tickets.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: It was a great show, Dad...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Let's go, Lainey.  There's nothing here.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Just a minute.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: God, it's so like your father.  Why can't people take responsibility for their actions anymore?  I can almost forgive him for killing Simone -- but denying her existence.  I can never forgive that.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Because obviously she existed, right?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I know it as surely as you're sitting here, sweetheart.  She was the most vital woman I ever met.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: So you did meet her?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Of course.  What are you suggesting?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I mean really meet her -- in the flesh.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I know it's embarrassing to admit it, mom, but when I think about it -- honestly, I haven't.  I mean, it feels like I have.  I know more about her than members of my own family.  She's even in my dreams. But I realized, going back through my diary, they were all TV appearances, near misses at parties, second-hand rumor, gossip on the internet.  I've never actually seen Simone up close, touched her, been in her physical presence.  Have you?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, I --

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: -- We don't believe daddy because we don't want to believe we were taken in too.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Lainey, there's no evidence that Simone isn't real.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Listen to what you're saying, mom. Is there any evidence she is?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: You had no choice, Elaine.  He's a liability.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: He also happens to be the most talented man I've ever known.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I can't believe she's doing this -- taking advantage of him this way. It's cruel.

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Obviously, this can't last.  She's going to dump him.  Viktor won't be able to take that.  He's too sensitive.  It'll destroy him.

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Elaine, do you realize you can't stop talking about Viktor?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I have to talk to her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank God for you, Faith.  I know this is above and beyond the call of duty for a stand-in.  You don't know what a service you're performing for Simone -- shielding her from those animals.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, thank God for you, Mr. Taransky.  How many men would go to so much trouble to protect a woman?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You understand you'll have to come back to my place to keep them off the, er...  ... scent.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You look so, so...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: ... so much like her?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes, of course, but very beautiful in your own right.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I do find myself physically attracted to you, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What?... What did you say?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Do what you do to Simone.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What I do to Simone?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes, call me Simone.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Simone?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes, yes, again, again.  Do what you do to Simone.  I want to know what it's like to be her just for one night.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You're with me to be close to her?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Is that a problem?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: "Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here".

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Please put your clothes on

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: Well, no one could accuse you of being over-exposed, Simone.  Why have you stayed so completely out of the limelight?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I just think actors talk too much. Does the world really want to hear your life story just because you've got a movie opening Friday?

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: Of course, the only problem with shying away from publicity these days is that it tends to attract more.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Don't I know it.  That's the only reason I'm here now -- to put the attention back where it belongs, on Mr. Taransky's film.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: You don't secretly want the attention?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I'm not even sure I deserve it. After tonight I'll have almost as much screen time on your show as I do in my movies.  How is that healthy for a performer?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Because, you have to understand, Frank, these interviews -- none of this is real.  Who I am on screen and who I really am are two totally different people.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: Who are you really?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: That's a good question.  As Nietzsche said, "Whenever a man strives long and hard to appear someone else..."

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: No, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: Let's talk about the work that you care so much about.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Sure.  Where would you like to start?

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: How about the nudity?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Nudity has just never been an issue for me, Frank.  For me, clothes are just an option.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: What exactly was it that attracted you to your first two projects?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I suppose the thing I like most about the movies I'm in is that they're not about special effects.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: -- Simone, the question on everyone's mind is simply... "why?"

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Frank, you know as well as I do, living in a fish bowl, the insatiable appetite of the media...

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: With everything that was going on in my life, I just needed to drop out of sight for a while -- I needed time.  Viktor bought me that time.  I owe him so much.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: We all do.  But now I understand you're eager to get back to work -- and not the kind of work that we're all expecting.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: That's true.  I can reveal that I am considering a career in politics.

turns.speaker: FRANK BRAND
turns.text: And what may I ask brought this on?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Nicola Anders is the only actress who can play that role.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's a re-make, Hal.  Anders is not bigger than this picture.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Viktor, I'm so happy for us!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Hello, Hal.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: The film.  The chemistry.  No reflections on Nicola but Simone and I -- we were just so right together.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You never were together, Hal.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: And still the connection was undeniable.  I haven't read "Eternity Forever" but I know it's brilliant.  And I know I would be perfect for Clive.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Clyde.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Yes, perfect.  As a matter of fact, I ran into Simone on the lot the other day.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Really?  She didn't mention it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm sure she's meeting with a lot of people right now.  She is just as you described her, Viktor... indescribable.  I strongly sensed she thought I was right for it.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You'll never guess who I'm with... you ran into him on the lot.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: It was more in passing.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You're so far off!  Hal... Hal Sinclair... your co- star.  Remember now?... No, I don't think he's put on weight.  Anyway, you think he's right for "Eternity Forever"?... not the right type?... a different direction...  I'll try to talk her into it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: How will you do our love scenes?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Body double.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: For her?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: For you.  I want you to know, Simone appreciates you all working for scale.  But why am I thanking you? Simone can thank you herself.  She insisted on speaking with you before filming begins.  She's on the line now.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Hal, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Viktor, Clyde simply has to get close to Simone in this scene!  He has to touch her.  He has to!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Absolutely not!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: But she's right there!  I must feel her!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You can't.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: There's... a wall between you --

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: -- an emotional wall, I know. That's why --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- No.  No.  A real wall.  You ran right through it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: How did the wall get there?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I can't explain it to you now -- you'll see when it's all put together.  Anyway, we got it a couple of takes ago.  Let's move on.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Is she here?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm fine, Hal.  How are you?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Somebody said she was here.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You know I sometimes forget she has bodily functions.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I know what you mean.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I have to talk to her about my experimental film.  It's very... experimental.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No.  In fact, between us, she doesn't really exist.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Simone!

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: -- Mr. Taransky, Mr. Taransky... thank God.  I've been trying to see you, calling -- Your assistant wouldn't put me through.  I told her it was a matter of life and death.  I was afraid I wouldn't get to you in time --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- Please, get away from me.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: I did it, Mr. Taransky.  I licked skin.  I licked hair.  I licked every part of her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You want me to call Security?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: I have her, Mr. Taransky.  The answer to your prayers.  The answer to this.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I was misquoted.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: I have your new leading lady...  ... right here in my pants.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: It's me, Mr. Taransky.  Don't you recognize me? -- The Future of Film conference in San Jose. Hank... Hank Aleno.  I was keynote speaker.  You must remember my speech... "Who Needs Humans?"

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: That's right.  You were booed off the stage.  That's got to be -- ?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: -- Eight years ago.  In that whole time, I never left my computer.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Good for you, Hank.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Good and bad.  They think that's what caused this.  Me eye tumor. Microwaves from the screen.  It's the size of a grapefruit.  Heavy too.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Don't be.  It was worth it.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: You have to see her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I've seen them all before.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Not like this --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Come on, Hank.  A synthespian, virtual actor -- ?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: -- We call them "vactors".

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I need flesh and --

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: -- Flesh is weak.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- a living, breathing actor -- I can't work with a fake.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: You already do.  But my actor won't get old, fat, lazy or drunk -- won't throw tantrums, demand a body double, script changes or a bigger trailer.  The Disney Corporation has been using artificial actors for years.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: That's the point, Hank.  No matter how good they are, they're still Mickey Mouse.  Everyone's tried. Everyone's failed.  It can't be done.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: It can -- with my new computer code, you and me, we can do it together.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I don't know anything about computers.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: That's why you're so perfect.  You have something I don't have.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: An eye -- for performance.  You know the truth when you see it.  I know.  I've seen your movies.  I love your movies.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: "Straw God" changed my life.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You saw that?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: I've seen every frame of your work. You're the only filmmaker in Hollywood with the artistic integrity to realize my vision. You and me, art and science... we are the perfect marriage.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Listen, Hank, it's been a rough day.  I'll call you about his next week.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: I won't be here next week.  The tumor's inoperable.  I'll be dead.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm already dead.

turns.speaker: PREMIERE REPORTER 2
turns.text: Harry!  Harry!  Can we have a minute?  What brings you here tonight?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I just came out to support my good friend, Simone.

turns.speaker: PREMIERE REPORTER 2
turns.text: There's a rumor that you're more than just "good friends"?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We've been seeing each other, sure, but we'd rather keep our relationship private.

turns.speaker: PREMIERE REPORTER 2
turns.text: Do I hear the sound of... wedding bells?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I can't believe you people!  No wonder she never comes to these things!

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Hi, Dad.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Hello, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I'm sorry Mom canned you.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's really... not anything, Lainey.  It's just --

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Don't feel too bad.  Mom runs the place and they still walk all over her.  You're better off out of it.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You look very grown up.  What are you doing?  You meeting your mom for dinner?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm going to finish the picture, sweetheart.  It's important.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I know you'll do it, Dad.  You're Viktor Taransky.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Hi, Dad.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Hello, Lainey.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Your mother couldn't make it?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: She's at the premiere of "A Cold Day In Hell".  But I think she send someone from Acquisitions.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She still with Kent?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: This week anyhow.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Not quite how I imagined it --

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: -- You finished the film on your own terms, that's what matters. Did you really do all the post yourself?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: There was no other way.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I missed you.  I wondered if you were ever coming back.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Well, I can't wait to meet Simone... what's her last name?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You know, I... don't know.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Is she here tonight?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She can't watch herself.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: She's a miracle, Dad.  Where did you find her?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I saw her picture on the, er... internet.  You really didn't notice anything -- unusual?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Only her brilliance.  To be honest, with what you had to work with, I was expecting a train wreck.  You really pulled it off.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Can't you stop that?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Those things can be dangerous. Staring at a screen all day -- you miss what's going on outside in the real world.  You can lose yourself. You should get out more.  How are you going to meet boys?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I know plenty of boys.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Really?  Who?  Where do you meet them?  In a chat room?  How do you know he's not some middle-aged freak?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Dad, I can spot a middle-aged freak a mile away.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Okay.  But you have to find a way to escape that thing.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I read.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You do?  Still?  I can't tell you how happy I am to hear that.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: You were the one who insisted on it.  Reading me Dostoyevsky and Joyce when I was four.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You understood them.  That's what was amazing.  It's a nice day.  Let's eat outside.
